_header: Within the treasure have I of my thought
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, ‘Love’s Mirror’, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 85) — three 9-line stanzas (ababbbcbc) and 4-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines:
WIthin the tresoure haue y of my thoughtA myrroure which y bought
                    but late parde…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…My myrroure hit shall riche me to y dyIn abidyng my gladsom
                    in good hope
BLHar682.Facsimiles:
